description: Mobile techniques used by Triada, ATT&CK software S0424 v1.0
name: Triada (S0424)

techniques.comment: [Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) is able to modify code within the com.android.systemui application to gain access to `GET_REAL_TASKS` permissions. This permission enables access to information about applications currently on the foreground and other recently used apps.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)
[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) variants capture transaction data from SMS-based in-app purchases.(Citation: Kaspersky Triada March 2016)

[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) injects code into the Zygote process to effectively include itself in all forked processes. Additionally, code is injected into the Android Play Store App, web browser applications, and the system UI application.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)(Citation: Kaspersky Triada March 2016)
[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) encrypts data prior to exfiltration.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)
Early [Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) variants were delivered through trojanized apps that were distributed via the Play Store.(Citation: Kaspersky Triada March 2016)
[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) utilizes a backdoor in a Play Store app to install additional trojanized apps from the Command and Control server.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)

[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) can redirect ad banner URLs on websites visited by the user to specific ad URLs.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)(Citation: Kaspersky Triada June 2016)
[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) utilized HTTP to exfiltrate data through POST requests to the command and control server.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019)

[Triada](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0424) was added into the Android system by a third-party vendor identified as Yehuo or Blazefire during the production process.(Citation: Google Triada June 2019) (Citation: Krebs-Triada June 2019)
